content.description: Start right hand crimp and left handle cobble sidepull (same start as Muzzle of Bees). Move right to a big incut, then out right to one of the coolest cobbles at Panther. Topout. Short problem, but fun, dynamic moves on big holds.
content.location: About 20 feet from left end of HUB roof.

content.description: Start as for No Time Like The Presdent, under the roof on the left hand side. Move up to th big jug, but instead of throwing for the lip, traverse right, moving past the jugs on Muzzle of Bees and Zig Zag, and topping out at the crack right of Zig Zag.
content.location: Starts on the left side of HUB, traverses right and tops out in the middle.

content.description: Start in large pocket in the dihedral, with your feet on the vertical wall. Move up to arete with your left, undercling another pocket with your right, then find a way to reach the large cobble jug in the middle of the top of the bulge. Topout all the way up or walkoff to the right.
content.location: Not on HUB proper, but is the bulge that shares landing with Fat Hunk. Start is in dihedral where the bulge meets the vertical wall.

content.description:
Start with a right hand crimp and left hand on a cobble sidepull. Move up and right through good holds to a toss for the lip, then topout. Short problem with fun, dynamic moves on big holds. 

  Var 1 - Start as for Muzzle of Bees, but traverse way left to holds on No Time Like The Present. From these holds, make a powerful and desperate cross into a good incut, then continue left to the lip. From the lip, move up along the arete, topping out left of where No Time tops out. v4/5
content.location: About 20 feet from left end of HUB roof.

content.description: Sit start under the roof, about five feet from the far left side. Move straight up through good holds, making a long move to pockets at the lip. Grade is probably height dependent.
content.location: Left side of HUB Roof, on uphill side of boulder.

content.description: Starts below the huge hueco on the West/Swouthwest face of the HUB on crimps and with feet on the boulder.  Move up to the hueco with a left hand, cut your feet, heel hook the hueco and dance up razor-blade pockets all the way to the top.  The crux is moving up from the hueco and the climbing eases up substantially from there.  A fall from the top would be real bad.
content.protection: Pads, a bunch of pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: Found on the West/Southwest face of the HUB about fifteen feet South of Fat Hunk of Burning Love.  Starts with feet on the big boulder and moves to the hueco and then up.

content.description:
Start matched on a big slopey cobble. Move straight up, choosing from a variety of decent holds.  

  Var. 1 - Start on cobble, but move directly left to a crimp and a pocket, continuing left past crack into jugs, then into cobbles on Zig Zag to topout. V2+
content.protection: Pad, spotter is not a bad idea
content.location: Right in front of the big boulder that sits in the middle of the roof area, right before the hill starts sloping down.

content.description: Crux is the at the top, getting your feet up, using two egg-sized pebbles. Start matched on a big pocket, facing downhill. Move right up the rail, then out to a jug-ledge, through a right-hand pocket and up to the pebbles. Feet up and you're done.
content.location: On the western bulge of the Hub.

content.description: Short overhanging prow with real solid holds. Sit down low, throw and heel and move up to the slopey lip and topout. Short, but fun.
content.location: Not on the HUB proper, but 20 feet due east of the eastern arete of HUB roof. Look for small boulder with obvious overhanging prow.

content.description: Start with left hand on slopey dish and right hand on good sidepull/ledge. Move straight up to right hand crimp, left hand sloper and then fire up to jug pocket in the scoop, then topout.
content.location: Start at base of overhanging prow (start is in same spot as Fat Hunk) on right side of HUB roof.

content.description:
A large, flat boulder resting atop another that creates a sheltered overhang all the way around. While not the true geographic center of the area it has the feeling of being in the middle of everything. 

  There are several steep lines on the uphill side.
